questions.question: Which of these is an infinite set?

answers.a: all rational numbers from $1$ to $1$ billion

explanations.a: There are infinitely many rational numbers between any two rational numbers.
explanations.b: There are infinitely many real numbers between any two real numbers.
explanations.c: there are infinite negative integers smaller than any integer.

questions.question: Consider a function where no two elements of the domain map to the same element in the co-domain and where the size of the domain and the co-domain is the same. Such function is ______.
Consider a function where two elements of the domain may map to the same element in the co-domain and where the size of the domain and the co-domain is the same. Such function is ______.
Consider a function where every element of the co-domain is mapped by some element of the domain. Such function is ______.
A function $f(x)=4x$ maps the set ${1,2,3,4}$ to the set ${1,2,...,16}$. The function is ______.

explanations.a: The function is one-to-one or injective because $f(x)$ maps distict values of domain to distinct values in co-domain.
explanations.b: The function is not surjective as there are elements in the co-domain that are not mapped to any element of the domain, for example 5.
explanations.c: The function is not bijective because it is not surjective. Bijective function must be both injective and surjective.
